content: Is the assumption correct that only the elements with the flag mustSupport = true are shown in the Snapshot Table (Must Support) and required elements (min = 1) with mustSupport = false are not shown? Has this always been the case or has something changed?

That is correct and has always been the case. There's a proposal to replace the mustSupport page with something different - that includes mandatory elements, modifier elements, elements with invariants not defined in the core resource and other elements of key interest to implementers, however that hasn't happened yet.
Thank you very much for the clarification and the comment :+1:

What is the current content of the "Snapshot Table (Must Support)" tab? I'm looking at it, and I don't see any elements flagged as MS. Is the view documented anywhere like diff, snapshot, xml, and json are?

(It also isn't what I expect when I see the phrase "snapshot table" -- it needs a better title to convey that it is filtered, key elements from the profile or parents.)

The only elements that show up there (right now) are those that are MS, so the MS flag isn't displayed as it would be redundant. There's a proposal to shift the view to include other key elements (mandatory elements, modifier elements, etc.). If we do that, the MS elements would be flagged again.
